flawed_nl_solution:
If there are 600 people at the fair this year, the number going to the fair next year is 2*600 = <<2*600=12000>>12000.
The number of people at the fair this year and the ones going next year totals 12000+600 = <<12000+600=12600>>12600
The number of people who went to that fair last year was 200 less than those going next year, meaning there were 12000-200 = 11800 people at the fair last year.
In the three years, the number of people at the fair will be 12600 of this and next year + 11800 of last year = <<12600+11800=24400>>24400
#### 24400

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 12000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
